# setDestinationWithName(_:for:)

**Instance Method**

Creates a link rectangle in the current page that jumps the PDF viewer to the named destination when clicked.

## Declaration

```swift
func setDestinationWithName(_ name: String, for rect: CGRect)
```

## Parameters

- **name**: The name of the destination point to which the PDF viewer jumps.
- **rect**: The region on the current page that becomes the active link area, specified in points in the PDF coordinate space.

## Discussion

Use this method in conjunction with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRendererContext/addDestination(withName:at:)] method to create internal links within a PDF. This method represents the creation of the links that, when clicked, jump the user to a named destination, created using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRendererContext/addDestination(withName:at:)] method.



For an example of how to use internal links, including mapping between coordinate spaces, see  [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRenderer#Creating-internal-links] in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsPDFRenderer].

## Managing destinations

- **addDestination(withName:at:)**: Creates a named destination point in the current PDF page.
- **setURL(_:for:)**: Creates a link to an external resource defined by a URL
